medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One month prior to admission, the patient had difficulty breathing and fever. Two weeks later, malaise and chills developed with diffuse pains in the arms and legs, managed with ibuprofen for two weeks with only minimal effect. Ten days before admission, pruritus developed, and the patient exhibited vomiting, extreme fatigue, malaise, and reduced urine output on the day of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension; abdominal hysterectomy with incidental appendectomy due to endometrial carcinoma six years prior. No recurrence of dyspnea or fever; no significant past medical conditions indicated.
medical_history.social_history: Former smoker of one pack daily for 20 years; stopped smoking 30 years prior. Consumes wine with dinner. Resides with husband and several children.
